update.description:
* Moved all SDF test worlds to `test/worlds`.

* Created a plugin directory under test.

* Replace the word 'test' with 'demo' in a few plugins and world files.

* Removed `sdf/models`. Some models will be moved into `gazebo_models`. The actor models were put into their respective world files.

* Moved `test/integration/media` to `test`.

* Removed some old collada files from `media/models`
update.title: Consolidated test files

content.raw: ran a few tests, seems to be all working.
content.html: ran a few tests, seems to be all working.

content.raw: This one seems really close to me. Just a bump for this question: should all the worlds in `/worlds` be installed? Currently only some of them are.
content.html: This one seems really close to me. Just a bump for this question: should all the worlds in /worlds be installed? Currently only some of them are.

content.raw: Do we need to keep sdf/CMakeLists.txt? It seems that the whole directory should be removed
content.html: Do we need to keep sdf/CMakeLists.txt? It seems that the whole directory should be removed

content.raw:
Is the goal for all the worlds in `/worlds` to be installed? Currently there are 50 worlds in that folder and only 33 are installed.

EDIT: I'm ready to approve once this last comment is resolved.
content.html:
Is the goal for all the worlds in /worlds to be installed? Currently there are 50 worlds in that folder and only 33 are installed.

EDIT: I'm ready to approve once this last comment is resolved.

content.raw: Yes,  this was intentional. It doesn't effect tests.
content.html: Yes, this was intentional. It doesn't effect tests.

content.raw: pull request #885 has now been merged, so I merged this branch with default and updated the physics_friction test in this branch to use the new world name (40a7c0b).
content.html: pull request #885 has now been merged, so I merged this branch with default and updated the physics_friction test in this branch to use the new world name (40a7c0b).

content.raw: actually just realized it's being renamed to `worlds/friction_demo.world`
content.html: actually just realized it's being renamed to worlds/friction_demo.world

content.raw: looks like `test_friction.world` is being deleted here. We should keep it as @scpeters uses it in pull request #885 .
content.html: looks like test_friction.world is being deleted here. We should keep it as @scpeters uses it in pull request #885 .

content.raw: This would be easier to review if it involved moving files without changing them, but there are a significant number of changes that accompany the moves. One approach is to split into more commits; i.e. one commit for moving files (ideally with the shell command included in the commit message), and then separate commits for modifying files.
content.html: This would be easier to review if it involved moving files without changing them, but there are a significant number of changes that accompany the moves. One approach is to split into more commits; i.e. one commit for moving files (ideally with the shell command included in the commit message), and then separate commits for modifying files.

content.raw: The car.model file has been removed, but car.world still refers to it.
content.html: The car.model file has been removed, but car.world still refers to it.

content.raw: The blank.world has changed slightly in the move from `sdf/worlds/` to `worlds/`. It's minor, but I'm just checking if it was an intentional change.
content.html: The blank.world has changed slightly in the move from sdf/worlds/ to worlds/. It's minor, but I'm just checking if it was an intentional change.

content.raw:
We should check if any of these worlds are used in tests. I know that the sphere_atlas_demo world is used in a [physics integration test (physics.cc:1586)](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/test/integration/physics.cc#cl-1586).

Also, it looks like the plugin used in the atlas_sphere_demo world was renamed in the repository but not in the world file.

EDIT: I updated the plugin name in the world file in de6d5bd.
content.html:
We should check if any of these worlds are used in tests. I know that the sphere_atlas_demo world is used in a physics integration test (physics.cc:1586).

Also, it looks like the plugin used in the atlas_sphere_demo world was renamed in the repository but not in the world file.

EDIT: I updated the plugin name in the world file in de6d5bd.
